CIFAR10 DatasetÂ¶

This example shows how to download/load/import CIFAR10

Out:

Loading cifar10:   0%|          | 0/5 [00:00<?, ?it/s]
Loading cifar10:  20%|##        | 1/5 [00:01<00:07,  1.97s/it]
Loading cifar10:  40%|####      | 2/5 [00:02<00:04,  1.58s/it]
Loading cifar10:  60%|######    | 3/5 [00:03<00:02,  1.25s/it]
Loading cifar10:  80%|########  | 4/5 [00:03<00:00,  1.08it/s]
Loading cifar10: 100%|##########| 5/5 [00:03<00:00,  1.19it/s]
Loading cifar10: 100%|##########| 5/5 [00:03<00:00,  1.27it/s]
Dataset cifar10 loaded in4.37s.


import symjax
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

cifar10 = symjax.data.cifar10.load()

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 4))
for i in range(10):

    plt.subplot(2, 5, 1 + i)

    image = cifar10['train_set/images'][i]
    label = cifar10['train_set/labels'][i]

    plt.imshow(image.transpose((1, 2, 0)) / image.max(), aspect='auto',
               cmap='Greys')
    plt.xticks([])
    plt.yticks([])
    plt.title('{}:{}'.format(label, cifar10['label_to_name'][label]))

plt.tight_layout()

Total running time of the script: ( 0 minutes 4.664 seconds)

Download Python source code: plot_cifar10.py
